meanings.sent1: She enjoys tagging her belongings with colorful stickers.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to tag your luggage before the trip.
meanings.sent3: He mistakenly tried tagging his pet cat with a 'fragile' label.
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature tagging on the mural added a unique touch.
meanings.sent5: Tagging your name on the wall is not allowed in this park.

meanings.sent1: The zookeeper is tagging the animals for identification.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to tag the price on each item for the garage sale.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly suggested tagging her friend with a 'free hugs' sign.
meanings.sent4: The scientist is tagging the migrating birds to track their journey.
meanings.sent5: Tagging the trees with colored ribbons helped the hikers find their way back.

meanings.definition: Identify or follow with a tag or marker
meanings.sent1: The detective is tagging the suspect's movements throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: Tagging the important pages in the book will make studying easier.
meanings.sent3: She playfully suggested tagging her friend with a 'lost' sign at the mall.
meanings.sent4: The team is tagging the whales to study their migration patterns.
meanings.sent5: Tagging the key points in the presentation will help the audience follow along.
